member.summary: Formats the exception and all nested inner exceptions.
member.param: The outer exception. This value will be null when writing the outer-most exception.

remarks.para: This method calls itself recursively until it reaches an exception that does not have an inner exception.

This is a template method which calls the following methods in order
If the specified exception has an inner exception then it makes a recursive call.

summary.para: Represents a handler for exceptions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.IExceptionHandler
member.summary: Defines the contract for an ExceptionHandler. An ExceptionHandler contains specific handling logic (i.e. logging the exception, replacing the excepiton, etc.) that is executed in a chain of multiple ExceptionHandlers. A chain of one or more ExceptionHandlers is executed based on the exception type being handled, as well as the .

summary.para: When implemented by a class, handles an .

param.name: exception
param.para: The exception to handle.

param.name: policyName
param.para: The name of the .

param.name: handlingInstanceId
param.para: The unique ID attached to the handling chain for this handling instance.

returns.para: Modified exception to pass to the next handler in the chain.

summary.para: When implemented by a class, gets or sets the current name of the using this handler.

value.para: The current name of the using this handler.

value.para: The current that will be handled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicy.HandleException(System.Exception,System.String)
member.summary: The main entry point into the Exception Handling framework. Handles the specified object according the current configuration.
member.param: The name of the policy to handle.
member.returns: Whether or not a rethrow is recommended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicy.HandleException(System.Exception,System.String,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Configuration.ConfigurationContext)
member.summary: The main entry point into the Exception Handling framework. Handles the specified object according the given .
member.param: The name of the policy to handle.
The configuration to be used in handling this exception
member.returns: Whether or not a rethrow is recommended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicy.HandleException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Checks if there is a policy entry that matches the type of the exception object specified by the parameter and if so, invokes the handlers associated with that entry.
member.returns: Whether or not a rethrow is recommended.
member.remarks: The algorithm for matching the exception object to a set of handlers mimics that of a standard .NET exception policy. The specified exception object will be matched to a single exception policy entry by traversing its inheritance hierarchy. This means that if a FileNotFoundException, for example, is caught, but the only exception type that the exception policy knows how to handle is System.Exception, the event handlers for System.Exception will be invoked because FileNotFoundException ultimately derives from System.Exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicy.GetPolicyEntry(System.Type)
member.devDoc: Gets the policy entry associated with the specified key.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicy.FindExceptionPolicyEntry(System.Type)
member.devDoc: Traverses the specified type's inheritance hiearchy

member.summary: Instantiates a new instance of the class.
